short_summary: The Department of Transport Canada has a requirement to provide CL604 and CL650 publications. The work will involve the subscription services to proprietary manuals and online data in support of maintenance and flight operations of the DND 412 SQN Challenger fleet of aircraft.
description: See the attached document for more information
full_summary:
**Advanced Contract Award Notice (ACAN) - CL604 and CL650 Publications**

The Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) hereby announces its intention to award a contract to a pre-identified supplier, Bombardier Aerospace, for the provision of CL604 and CL650 publications. The procurement is subject to the following trade agreements: Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Background and Objectives**

Transport Canada requires subscription services to proprietary manuals and online data in support of maintenance and flight operations of the DND 412 SQN Challenger fleet of aircraft.

**Requirements**

The chosen supplier must have exclusive rights to manufacture Challenger aircraft and parts, and manage and distribute maintenance and flight operations publications in paper and electronic formats.

**Pre-Identified Supplier**

The pre-identified supplier for this contract is Bombardier Aerospace, with whom the department has a sole source standing offer for the procurement of subscription services to proprietary manuals and online data.

**Trade Agreements and Intellectual Property**

The procurement is subject to CETA, WTO-AGP, CPTPP, and CFTA. The contracting authority reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers and to retain ownership of any foreground intellectual property arising out of the proposed contract.

**Contract Duration and Value**

The proposed contract is for a period of 5 years, from December 1, 2023, to November 30, 2028, with an option to extend the contract period for a further 5 years. The estimated value of the contract, including options, is $1,000,000 to $2,000,000.

**Notice of Intent**

The Crown intends to award the contract to the above-identified supplier. Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the services described may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to the contact person identified below on or before October 6, 2023, at 2:00 p.m. EST.

**Contact Information**

Jeffrey Pakeman
Supply Team Leader
Public Works and Government Services Canada
11 Laurier St.
Gatineau, QC K1A 0S5
Telephone: (343) 572-5074
Email: Jeffrey.Pakeman@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
